alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:04PM CDT until August 23 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BURLEIGH AND NORTHEASTERN MORTON COUNTIES... At 903 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bismarck, Mandan, Lincoln, Mcdowell Dam Recreation Area and Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
